content.description: This route follows an easy-fifth-class gully/ramp to the right. Where it ends, start clipping bolts as the rock gradually steepens past vertical. The anchor bolts are visible from the ground.
content.protection: Seven bolts, plus optional gear for the gully/ramp. While being lowered with a 60m rope, the leader can unclip the lowest three bolts, making a lot of rope available. Be careful with that sudden extra slack.
content.location: This route is listed as number G on the Main Slab page. It begins in the same place as the profusely bolted 12-.

content.description:
Start from the base of the ramp/gully at the right side of the slab.  Follow the line of bolts angling up and right to where they join a crack.  Follow the bolts up through the roof above.

The moves down low are tenuous and challenging.  The bolted crack and hollow rock through the roof detract from this otherwise good route.
content.location: This is the 5th bolted route from the left.

content.description:
This shares the start with

Unknown 3

.  Follow the line of bolts up and to the right through the roof above.
content.location: Currently this is the 4th bolted route from the left.

content.description:
Start to the right of

Orange Peel

.  Follow the line of bolts up through the roof above.

Eds. there is a variation that goes left after the 8th bolt to a separate set of anchors.
content.protection:
13 bolts, 2 bolt anchor.

Eds. note that the 2 anchor bolts here appear to be set in a protrusion of rock that could be weakened with a freeze/thaw cycle.  One could back up the anchors with #2 1/2 and #3 Friends and 4+ foot slings.
content.location:
This is to the right of

Orange Peel

, and it is currently the 3rd bolted route from the left.  See the photo.

content.description:
This route ascends the right side of what could be an excellent slab climb. This route and its companion,

Unknown 1

, are unfortunate, because the slab climb that splits the two routes is great and would have been a wonderful addition to the area at a 10+ grade.

Climb the right side of the slab, sometimes laying back the offwidth crack to its right.  About 2/3 of the way up, make a sharp turn to the right and follow the bolts through the roof.
content.location: This is the second bolted route from the left.

content.description:
This route ascends the left side of what could be an excellent slab climb.  This route and its companion,

Unknown 2

, are unfortunate, because the slab climb that splits the two routes is great and would have been a wonderful addition to the area at a 10+ grade.

Climb the left side of the slab laying back and sometimes straddling the offwidth crack.

Climb this route to get to the anchors, so you can top rope the slab to its right.
content.location: Starting from the left, this is the first bolted route.

content.description:
This is the rightmost of at least three parallel offwidths. Start just right of “

Unknown 2

” and ascend parallel to that route, just to the right, in the obvious wide crack. The cruxes are committing: insecure rounded liebacks, smearing the left foot while fighting the barndoor.
content.protection: I placed my single #5 four times. I placed a # 6 once, because I had it. It was only a few feet below the higher of two bolts that I clipped. I clipped the two bolts that are close to the crack. I also placed a yellow C3 and green, red, yellow, blue, and gray C4s, plus a #11 Hex.

content.description:
We did this route from the ground up.  There is a lot of lichen, and you may have to dig a little in the crack to get a placement.

The route ascends the crack to the left of the left-facing corner right of

Unknown 2

.  The route climbs through orange lichen and rock.  Start by scrambling to the top of the detached, left-leaning pillar.  A key 1.5 inch placement above and behind you protects the next moves and will keep you off the deck.  Climb the shallow crack up and left to the ledge.  Climb the layback hand crack up and to the right to the roof above

Unknown 3

.  Climb through the roof, skipping the bolts for

Unknown 3

and placing gear instead.
content.location:
This is right of

Unknown 2

, see the photo.

content.description:
This is a route on the right side of the main slab area.  If you know the name or the FA, please let me know.

It chases a line of bolts up a gully and briefly onto a prow.  It is still a bit gritty and lichen-covered.  Oddly, there doesn't seem to be any anchor bolts, although it has a 2 bolt anchor down low for a 2nd rappel and a bolt sleeve up top (in a bulging, fragile bit of rock)?  There is another bolt out to the right of the 3rd bolt.   You can go right or left (licheny) from the 2 bolt anchor down low. Anchor off a tree ~40' back from the edge.
content.location: This is to the right of the slab area and ascends a gully.
